authorization by contacting ACCC Network Operations Center  Fire suppression and environmental controls  ACCC will ensure the data center operates within the Industry (ASHRAE) recommend cooling range for data centers  ACCC will notify tenant of planned maintenance and incidents that may impact co-located equipment  In case of a planned outage for an infrastructure system (e.g., power outage, UPS testing), each tenant will be contacted in advance  Change controls and planned outages will occur during the standard change control window  Infrastructure components and systems are covered meet rack mount specifications  Contact information for server administrators, departmental personnel, and hardware inventory must be updated / kept current at all times   Applicability  Clients are responsible for adhering to the following Administrative Guidelines while utilizing this service:   Tenant must not interfere with ACCC hardware or property, including moving raised-floor tiles  Tenant is not authorized to use data center space for long-term storage of non-production hardware or accessories (e.g. cardboard boxes)  Tenants are responsible for not overloading their circuits and are required to contact the ACCC Staff prior to executing new equipment installations  Tenants of this service are responsible for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the equipment in their rack(s)  Data Center access on your key card or allowing an escorted guest means you are agreeing to the terms outlined in the Data Center access agreement document               Google Maps
